release.action: Moved JMS CTS from the OpenJMS project, and changed license to the Exolab Project license
Added support for building JMS CTS with maven. The website, documentation and releases are now produced via the maven build.
Added coverage of MessageProducer.getTimeToLive() and MessageProducer.setTimeToLive().
Added coverage of section 3.4.7 - JMSRedelivered, as per RFE 817173.
Added coverage of section 3.4.9 - JMSExpiration
Added coverage for message republication, as per RFE 823464.
Changed reporting for RFE 826562 - order requirements, test cases in coverage.html
Changed reporting to include stack traces in failure descriptions.
Added coverage of section 3.12 - Provider Implementations of JMS Message Interfaces, as per RFE 867564.
Fixed bug 819193 - Can't filter tests on ack type
Fixed bug 818994 - Errors in test setUp() and tearDown() not reported
Fixed bug 887462 - QueueBrowser should be excluded from connection.stopped test
Fixed bug 879678 - StreamMessageTest.testIncrementalReadBytes() not compliant
Added greater coverage of the specification. The CTS now covers approximately 80% of the specification and executes over 15000 test cases
Added support for stress testing
Now generate compliance reports in HTML
Added coverage of the JMS selector and queue browser APIs
Added utility to take a coverage report snapshot while the JMS CTS is running
Added functions to stop and abort the JMS CTS

The initial release of the JMS CTS. This includes the following features:
Coverage of the JMS message, session, producer, consumer and connection APIs
Compliance reports, generated in XML
Simple interface to plug in different JMS implementations
Complete automation, to support regression testing
Test case filtering, to narrow testing to help locate problem areas
